noPermission.description_limit_premium: You have reached the maximum number of AutoVoice available in your plan. Upgrade to the Premium plan to unlock unlimited AutoVoice!
noPermission.description_premium_feature: This feature is only available with the Premium plan. Upgrade your plan now to unlock it!
noPermission.description_embed: You do not have permission to use this command!
noPermission.description_embed_no_features: The function is currently disabled. An administrator needs to enable it for it to be usable.
noPermission.description_embed_no_features_by_system: This feature is temporarily disabled for scheduled maintenance. Please bear with us; it will be available again shortly.

selectSetup.description_embed:
Welcome to the setup to configure the Auto Voice System. First, let's carefully choose what type of Auto Voice we want to configure. We have two options:
- **Interaction Create**: Creation through interaction occurs via a textual channel that will serve as the container of the message allowing its creation through a component (button).
- **Automatic Create**: Creation through the automatic process occurs via a voice channel that will serve as the entry point to initiate the process. Every user accessing it will consequently have a voice channel created.

*(!) No channels should be created; Alka will handle their creation.*
selectSetup.description_embed_two: You have initiated the process of creating the **Auto Voice System**, we have created the channel {0} for you, follow there for configuration.

selectSetup_Creator.description_embed:
We have selected the type of Auto Voice we want to use, now we need to select whether we want to use private or open-access channels:
- **Private:** The private category utilizes a permission system that is recorded in the relational database. This system allows the user, through a command that requires the assignment of permission hashes (Read the documentation), to grant access to certain users in their own private voice channel.
- **Free:** The free category does not use permission systems and allows open access to everyone. It can be useful as a lobby for rooms of various games to allow for party searching.

selectSetup_TypeAccess.description_embed:
We're almost there, now we need to choose what type of name we want our channels to have! This time we have three choices:
- **Numeric:** By setting a name for the channel, that name will be used to automatically increment the number, for example: (Voice 1, Voice 2, Voice 3).
- **Nickname:** We will use the user's nickname and this selection will control to prevent multiple channels being created to prevent channel cloning.
- **Random:** We will set a random number to the channel, for example: (8456246).

endSetup_message.description_embed: You have successfully completed the Auto Voice setup. Your voice channels are now configured to function as you selected during the setup phase.
endSetup_message.description_embed_errorcategory: We have cancelled the Auto Voice setup; you cannot set up a category that already has an Auto Voice assigned. Please create a new one!

select_category.description_embed: Now we choose the category where you want the channels to be created.

select_size.label: Maximum number of people in the channel
